note.p: Career: Pioneer in the scientific stuudy of coral reefs, conducting a classical study of reefs in the Indian cean, with three expeditions there in 1899-1900, 1905 and 1908. Used these expeditions as experience in the preparation of the 1928-1929 Great Barriere reed Expedition organized at the request of the Governor General of Queensland by a specially formed Committee of the British Association for the Advancement of Science.
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1945-1948 vol 5 pp 541-553, plate, by C Forster-Cooper
References: B E Brown, 'The legacy of Professor John Stanley Gardiner FRS to reef science' in NR 2007 vol 61 pp 207-217
